key_points: Lawyers for Remington Arms, sued by nine families of Sandy Hook shooting victims, subpoenaed academic records for five slain students.
Attorneys for the families asked the court to seal the students' confidential records.
Remington also subpoenaed employment files for educators involved in the case.
The Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting in 2012 resulted in 26 deaths.
Remington manufactured the Bushmaster AR-15 rifle used in the shooting.
The families sued Remington for wrongful death, citing reckless marketing of the Bushmaster to civilians.
Remington filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in 2018 and again the following year.
No immediate response was received from Remington or their lawyer for comments.
Families' lead attorney, Joshua Koskoff, criticized Remington's request for records as irrelevant and an invasion of privacy.
Remington offered a $33 million settlement in July; the plaintiffs have not responded yet.
spokespersons: Joshua Koskoff (Lead Attorney for the families)
